org.opensextant.extractors.geo.social

Class SimpleProcessorDemo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opensextant.extractors.geo.social.SimpleProcessorDemo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.opensextant.data.social.JSONListener

    public class SimpleProcessorDemo
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.opensextant.data.social.JSONListener
    SimpleProcessor is a demonstration of some geoinferencing techniques:
    • Tagging Free text: deep geotagging and geocoding of natural language text such as social media excerpts
    • Inferring location based on metadata: geographic reasoning on metadata innate in social media, given or derived
    • Other techniques from publications or internal R&D.

    Usage:

    While the demo() or main() method are the entry points for this executable, the readObject( JSONObject ) method is the primary demonstration detail. It shows:

    • how we have prepared a tweet or other data for inferencing (mainly langID, parsing of data into JSON and then into a Tweet API object, etc)
    • how the various stack of inferencing phases are called
    • finally, once you have annotations (geo or other), you can then save them somewhere.

    Author:
    ubaldino

      • startup

        public boolean startup(java.lang.String[] args)
                throws org.opensextant.ConfigException
        Initialization work for the demo. Did I say this is just a demo?

        There are number of obscure input and setup concerns in this demo, as it tries to capture a wide range of cmd line use cases

        Items setup: Parse Arguments, Configure input sources/files, configure requested geoinferencers, configure language ID tool.

        Parameters:
        args -
        Returns:
        false if startup failed.
        Throws:
        org.opensextant.ConfigException - if startup is attempted by encounters IO or other Configuration errors.

      • preferJSON

        public boolean preferJSON()
        that is, if preferJSON==true then sf.net.json will be used to parse the line and send JSONObject to your reader. If you do not prefer JSON, then the raw String is passed for you to parse with readObject(String) Generally ignore this.
        Specified by:
        preferJSON in interface org.opensextant.data.social.JSONListener

      • readObject

        public void readObject(jodd.json.JsonObject obj)
                throws org.opensextant.data.social.MessageParseException
        This is a much abbreviated demonstration. Usually: read all data and condition it on ingest - process data as much as possible in parallel This method shows reading data from a file, processing it using 1 to N number of inferencers and then outputing the the annotations from processing... all in a very serial fashion. This is only for demonstration.
        Specified by:
        readObject in interface org.opensextant.data.social.JSONListener
        Throws:
        org.opensextant.data.social.MessageParseException
